references.paper_title: nuScenes: A multimodal dataset for autonomous driving
references.reason: This paper is foundational because it introduces the nuScenes dataset, a crucial resource used for training and evaluating autonomous driving models.  The multimodal nature of the dataset, encompassing various sensor modalities including LiDAR, makes it particularly relevant for the research presented, which focuses on 4D LiDAR scene generation.

references.paper_title: MotionSC: Data set and network for real-time semantic mapping in dynamic environments
references.reason: This paper introduces the CarlaSC dataset, a crucial resource for training and evaluating 4D LiDAR scene generation models. The dataset's focus on dynamic scenes makes it a perfect fit for benchmarking the capabilities of models aimed at capturing the temporal evolution of LiDAR data.

references.paper_title: Hexplane: A fast representation for dynamic scenes
references.reason: This paper introduces HexPlane, a novel 4D scene representation that is central to the DynamicCity framework. Its ability to efficiently encode spatial-temporal information in a compact format is critical to the success of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Scalable diffusion models with transformers
references.reason: This paper introduces Diffusion Transformers (DiT), the core generative model used in DynamicCity. The scalability and efficiency of DiT are crucial for generating high-quality 4D LiDAR scenes, which are often large and complex.

references.paper_title: OccSora: 4D occupancy generation models as world simulators for autonomous driving
references.reason: This paper introduces OccSora, a state-of-the-art 4D LiDAR generation model that serves as a strong baseline for comparison in this work.  Comparing DynamicCity's performance against OccSora demonstrates the advancements achieved.

references.paper_title: Occ3D: A large-scale 3D occupancy prediction benchmark for autonomous driving
references.reason: This paper introduces the Occ3D datasets (Occ3D-Waymo and Occ3D-nuScenes), which are used extensively for training and evaluating the DynamicCity model. The large scale and real-world nature of these datasets are critical for evaluating the generalization capabilities of the model.

references.paper_title: Make-a-video: Text-to-video generation without text-video data
references.reason: This is a highly influential paper in the field of video generation which inspires the techniques used for 4D scene generation. While not directly related to LiDAR, its insights in video modeling provide a valuable background for generating dynamic point clouds.

references.paper_title: The Lovász-softmax loss: A tractable surrogate for the optimization of the intersection-over-union measure in neural networks
references.reason: This paper introduces the Lovász-softmax loss function, a key component of the DynamicCity framework.  This loss function is crucial for evaluating the quality of generated scenes and ensuring accurate segmentation of objects within those scenes.

references.paper_title: Deep generative modeling of lidar data
references.reason: This paper is important because it explores early attempts at generative models for LiDAR data, providing context and establishing a foundation upon which subsequent research, including this work, builds. It highlights the need for methods to capture the complex spatial relationships present in LiDAR scans.

references.paper_title: Scalability in perception for autonomous driving: Waymo open dataset
references.reason: This paper introduces the Waymo Open Dataset, a significant dataset used for evaluating many autonomous driving systems.  Although not directly used in the current model training, the context provided by this dataset is important to understanding the real-world applications of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Learning to drop points for lidar scan synthesis
references.reason: This paper represents early work on LiDAR scene generation which provides a starting point for understanding the challenges involved in generating realistic LiDAR data. This work's limitations further emphasize the need for advancements in generating high-quality 4D scenes which this paper aims to address.

references.paper_title: Classifier-free diffusion guidance
references.reason: This paper presents Classifier-Free Guidance (CFG), a technique employed in DynamicCity for conditional generation.  The ability to control the generation process through CFG is crucial for achieving the various downstream applications demonstrated in this work.

references.paper_title: Make-a-video: Text-to-video generation without text-video data
references.reason: This highly influential paper in video generation demonstrates techniques that are relevant to the methods used in this paper for 4D scene generation. The paper's insights into video modeling provide a background for generating dynamic point clouds.

references.paper_title: SemCity: Semantic scene generation with triplane diffusion
references.reason: This paper introduces SemCity, a model which attempts to generate large-scale 3D scenes. While not directly addressing the 4D aspect, it provides a relevant comparison and context for DynamicCity which significantly improves generation quality by using HexPlane and a diffusion model based on DiT.

references.paper_title: Lidar4D: Dynamic neural fields for novel space-time view lidar synthesis
references.reason: This paper is significant because it explores the use of dynamic neural fields for 4D LiDAR scene generation.  The comparison of DynamicCity against Lidar4D helps to illustrate the advancements made by using HexPlane and DiT in generating high-quality long-sequence 4D LiDAR data.

references.paper_title: Rethinking the inception architecture for computer vision
references.reason: This paper introduces the Inception model which is a fundamental component of the Inception Score, one of the main evaluation metrics in this paper. This model is used to assess the quality and diversity of the generated LiDAR scenes.

references.paper_title: Very deep convolutional networks for large-scale image recognition
references.reason: This paper introduces the VGG-16 model which is another critical model for measuring the performance of this paper. Precision and Recall metrics are calculated using a pre-trained VGG-16 model, highlighting its importance in assessing the accuracy of generated scenes.

references.paper_title: PyTorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
references.reason: This paper is significant because PyTorch is the deep learning framework used in this research. PyTorch's features such as automatic differentiation and extensive community support are essential for efficiently training and evaluating the proposed model.

references.paper_title: FlashAttention: Fast and memory-efficient exact attention with IO-awareness
references.reason: This paper presents FlashAttention, an optimization technique used to speed up attention mechanisms in the DiT model.  This optimization is critical for handling the computational demands of generating long sequences of high-resolution 4D LiDAR scenes.

references.paper_title: Searching efficient 3D architectures with sparse point-voxel convolution
references.reason: This paper's work on efficient 3D architectures directly improves the performance of the VAE used in DynamicCity. This is because the improved efficiency and performance enable more effective encoding of 4D LiDAR scenes.
